snippet: At the trial of three men, a former New York City housing official described accepting bribes for approving developers who wanted to build affordable homes with the city.
abstract: Wendell B Walters, former assistant commissioner for New York City Housing Preservation and Development Dept who was in charge of approving applications from developers who wanted to build affordable housing, makes his debut in court as a cooperating government witness; testifies that he accepted large cash bribes from developers Stevenson Dunn, Lee Hymowitz and Michael Freeman.
lead_paragraph: At the trial of three men, a former New York City housing official described accepting bribes for approving developers who wanted to build affordable homes with the city.

headline.main: Ex-Official Tells of Cash and Refrigerators as Bribes
headline.print_headline: Ex-Official Tells of Cash and Stoves as Bribes

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations
